title: Traveling Salesmen
description: Dwight does a favor for Angela to keep her from getting in trouble. Andy finds out and uses it against him to get in tighter with Michael. Now Dwight must fess up, which will reveal his relationship with Angela, or risk getting fired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, could you come in here please?

quotes.speaker: Harvey
quotes.text: Hi, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Harvey
quotes.text: I am Harvey, a computer. Jim sucks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry, oh wow, that's so rude. I'm sorry, I can't control him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Get Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: For this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Harvey
quotes.text: Pam, you look very hot today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, meet Harvey. This is Michael's new friend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Harvey
quotes.text: Me so horny. Me love you long tim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that is gross.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who is 'Long Tim'?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Harvey
quotes.text: Long time. Me lobe yoy long time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh well, 'Yoy' should bring in 'Long Tim' in one day. Shouldn't he?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I would love to meet Long Tim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Harvey
quotes.text: You ruined a funny joke, you. Get out of my offive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. Bye Harvey.

quotes.speaker: Harvey
quotes.text: Boobs.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That was a voicemail that corporate left last night. They did not get our tax forms. Did you send them?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: They arrived this morning.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you sure? It is a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is it a big deal? Is it Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: ... Do you really not know? Because it is a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Five of us transferred from Stamford. There are two of us left. Me and Karen. It's like we are touring Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory and dropping off one by one. Well, guess what? I am not falling in a chocolate river.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Everything ok? [Takes candy from Pam's desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everything is fine. You are in the clear.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you. [Puts candy back] I... I don't want those.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, care to join us, finally? Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Dwight, pass the tardy sauce. Get it Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Ok, here is the dream team. My sales dream team. Today we are going to team up for sales calls. Andy, since this was your idea, you get to pick first.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hmmm, well... let me think about this for a minute. Oh, I don't know. Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ph. D. Doctor of Sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I appreciate that. That is very gracious of you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, it is very gracious of you to accept.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, thank you sir. Ok, now going by seniority. Phyllis, our resident senior.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We're the same age and I'll pick... Karen.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, uh, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Next up, Superfly himself, Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Pass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can't pass. You've got to pick somebody.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: ... I'll take the kid.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I am very flattered. I was his second choice after "Pass."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So that just leaves Dwight and Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, wait. Does anyone want to trade?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup. I'll trade.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight and I used to go on sales calls all the time. In fact, I have a picture to remember that time. Oh young Jim. There is just so much I need to warn you about. And yet, tragically, I cannot.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sebring by Chrysler. Heck of a... motor... carriage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yup?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here ya go. [throws laundry]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah! You want shirts on hangers?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: He does your laundry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Long story. All right everybody, circle up. Here we go. You know what this is? This is the "Amazing Race." [To Ryan and Stanley] And you guys are the retired marines. [To Phyllis and Karen] And you guys are the mother and daughter. [To Dwight and Jim] And you guys are the gay couple. And we are the firefighter heroes. Are we ready to go?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Wait, "Amazing Race" like, the biggest sale wins?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we're just going to rush out, do the sales thing, and come back.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is there a prize?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just bragging rights.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Then how is this "Amazing Race"?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's just... brrrrrr... It's "Amazing Race," Phyllis. Okay? We're in teams of two and we are on a mission. All right, so, on your mark, get set, go. Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on!!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael. [Michael throws Phyllis' keys under the car.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoah, whoah. Oh hahahaha. Vamanos!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Bueno.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Do you have a pole?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Let's go get a broom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Seriously? You're going to sit in the back?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, yeah. It's the safest part of the car. In the event of a crash, the driver always protects his side of the car first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: In order to take down Dwight, I have to chip away at his ally, which, in this case, is Michael. Here's the good news. Every success I've ever had at my job or with the lady-folk has come from my ability to slowly and painfully wear someone down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's the deal with Dwight doing your laundry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh... that is a long story. Um, couple of months ago, Dwight tried to go behind my back with Jan and get my job and I am now having him do my laundry as punishment.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow, that is a long story, but quite well told, Michael. I find it very interesting. Especially about the part Dwight going behind your back and basically, like, being a terrible person. You know if you want your laundry done right? I used to work at Abercrombie. So, pretty good folder.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey Pam. Would you like to go with me to grab a coffee?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, I could use some fresh air. Might be fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. Sure.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Why are we turning in here, this is a beauty salon?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Um-hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, do you mind if I take the lead on this one and then you can critique me after?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You want the lead?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, if you don't mind.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mind? Nothing would delight me more.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Leave the keys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You still do that thing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Leave the keys!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think you have assembled an amazing team at Scranton. It's really a pleasure to be a part of it. It's like, everyone has their own special skill, you know, just like the Superfriends. Except for Dwight, who is more like a SuperDud. I mean, he would be a Superfriend if there was a Superfriend whose super power was always being late. You know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hawkman.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My plan is taking longer than I thought but I don't give up easily. I have walked two marathons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Walks out of the Ladies' Restroom] Let's go. The men's room was disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: After you sir.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No thank you, I never let anyone walk behind me. Seven out of ten attacks are from the rear.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, well, that still leaves a 30% chance that I will attack you from the front.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, but it will be easier to stop. I can always block the blow. I can counter it with... [Jim slaps Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela, you seem so happy. I bet you wish you were like this all the time.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This friend of mine - let's call her Noelle - she missed this deadline turning something in to Corporate in New York. But then this gallant gentleman - we'll call him Kurt - he drove all the way to New York and handed it in for her. That's... I don't know. I guess he really just likes her a lot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's great.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, it is. [Walks up to the counter where there is no employee] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, did you catch that up at Lake Wallenpaupack?

quotes.speaker: Buyer
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, I used to go up there all the time with my step-dad, and I never caught anything that big.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Caught an eighty-pound shark off of Montauk. It's in the Hamptons. My dad's got a 42-ft Bayliner. Sniped it with a rifle from the crow's nest. Also shot a deer once.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Let's get right down to it. Dunder-Mifflin may be just two rooms and a warehouse, but what we lack in flash, we will make up for with hardwork and decency.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok, this is the classic undersell because you should know we don't work out of a log cabin. We trade on the New York Stock Exchange. Ever heard of it? It's in New York.

quotes.speaker: Buyer
quotes.text: Uh, I have to say I am a little wary with getting involved with a big company. We've had some problems in the past.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think what Andy is trying to express is that while we have the resources of a large company, we will give you the care and attention of a small company.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, man, that is, like, poetry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I swear, this guy could sell paper to a tree.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it. [Puts his hand on Andy's shoulder] Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh man. Talk about your classic "Lame dash O." Do we even want that guy buying our paper?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I... I'm so sorry man. I really screwed that up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, no. Don't worry about it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I really 'Schruted' it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: 'Schruted' it. It's just this thing that people say around your office all the time. Like, when you screw something up in a really irreversible way, you 'Schruted' it. I don't know where it comes from though. Do you think it comes from Dwight Schrute?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know. Who knows how words are formed.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's a big order. Thanks Kenny.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, how's Annie?

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: Oh, she's great. This is us last year in Bermuda. Lovely place. You ever been to Bermuda?

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Ah, Julius, how's it goin'?

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: Great, great, great.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So good to see you too. I'd like you fellas to meet Ryan Howard.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm gonna let Ryan do a little pitch for you while I do my crossword. Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um... [To the Buyers] Hi. Hi. Hi. Hi.

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: Hello, Ryan. What do you have for us?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can offer our biggest discounts on 30% recycled and ultra-premium laser.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: 'Kay. 'Kay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I use your phone?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Yeah, sure, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let me talk to you about a few of the other things we can offer. Namely, we know the tax season is coming up, so by April 1st we can have you fully stocked.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [On Phone] One...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We have discount prices on ink cartridges...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Three...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And, also, any forms that you are going to need...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Seven...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can custom make them.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Ha ha ha! And you just said, "Hi! Hi! Hi!" Ha heh ha! You sounded like my niece, and she's six months old!

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: We'll I appreciate what you guys are saying but it, uh, makes more fiscal sense to go with one of the big guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure, that's true we can't compete with their prices. But let me ask you something. How important to you is customer service?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: It's very.

quotes.speaker: Phone
quotes.text: Please keep holding, your call is very important to us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Erm, that's one of the 'Big guys.' Been on hold this whole time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Dials cell Phone] And this is Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Dunder-Mifflin customer service, this is Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Kelly, it's Jim.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my god, Jim. How are you ? I wanted to tell you ... . [Jim hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here is my card. It's got my Cell number, my pager number, my home number, and my other pager number. I never take vacations, I never get sick, and I don't celebrate any major holidays.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: All right, I get it. We got a deal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thanks. That was fun.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I really enjoy spending time with you. You are a very nice person.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm so glad you're with Jim. He was hung up on Pam for such a long time. Never thought he would get over her.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: That's nice.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You can pay me back later for the makeover.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey boss. Got a minute?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I forget, why did Dwight say he was late this morning?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He didn't say.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's weird. Because I was just walking past his desk and I saw this, which is a tollbooth receipt from New York City, stamped really early this morning. So, why would Dwight go to New York without telling anyone? Do you think he went to see Jan? That's not like him. Is it? Someone told me a story about this, with, like, laundry and betrayal. Did you betray Dwight and try to steal his job or something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you are remembering it wrong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight betrayed me once before. So this is his strike two. You know what they say? Fool me once, strike one. But fool me twice, strike three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I like Karen. She's pretty and appears intelligent.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I like pretty women who have the appearance of intelligence.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My girlfriend is also beautiful and smart. She could be a model or a college professor which is intimidating to a lot of guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We should go on a double date.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Dwight's name is on the security sign-in sheet, but I don't know who he met with. And where it asks to state your business, he wrote "Beeswax. Not yours, Inc."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I knew it. [Dwight and Jim walk in]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, doggie.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, do you want to grab a coffee?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure. Look at you!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, we nailed the sale!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where were you this morning?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I overslept. Damn rooster didn't crow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why do you lie, liar?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am not a liar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are lying right now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It sure seems like he is lying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stay out of this, you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know that you went to corporate this morning, and I know that you lied about it. And given our history, I need you tell me this instant exactly what you were doing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I cannot tell you what I was doing there. But you have to trust me, I would never do anything to hurt you or this company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, you know what? I want you to think about your future in this company. I want you to think about it long and hard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't. Don't you dare. I want to know what you were doing this morning by the end of the day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's going to be ok.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How is going to be ok, Dwight? Everyone will know our business.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's not the worst thing in the world. I'll just stand up in front of the office and reveal our true love. It won't be that bad. Look at Kelly and Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I hate those two people more than anything in the entire world.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I don't have a lot of choices.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: So, let me ask you a question.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Did you ever have a thing for Pam?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam? Did I ever have a 'thing' for her? No, why? Did she say something?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I moved here from Connecticut...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Ok, here's the ... I had a crush on her before I left. And I told her about it and she didn't feel the same way. So, it didn't amount to anything, and I left. I'm really glad you're here. 'Kay?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: 'Kay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ahem-hem-hem. May I have your attention please? This will only take a moment of your time. Although I love this company more than almost anything in the world, I have decided to step down from my post and spend more time with my family. I do not fear the unknown and I will meet my new challenges head-on and I will succeed. And I will laugh in the faces of those who doubt me. It has been a pleasure working with some of you and I will not forget those of you soon but remember, while today it is me, we all shall fall. In other words, I am quitting. So... .

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oompa-Loompa Doompity-Dawesome, Dwight is now gone which is totally awesome.  Why was he gone, he was such a nice guy?  No, he was not.  He was a total douche.  Doompity-doomp.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would like to give the rest of my belongings to Michael Scott. Just take them. Except this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dwight will be missed. Not by me so much, but, he will be missed.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight, from sales, was one of the most honorable and efficient employees this company has ever had.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One of my life goals was to die right here in my desk chair. And today, that dream was shattered.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey man. [Dwight hugs Jim and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What happened on your sales call?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, am I happy the way things turned out? Oh, well, happy's such an ugly word. But, um, I saw what needed to be done and I did it and now I'm thrilled. So, it's pretty... [camera had focused in on Angela watching] Hello? Pretty good.
